Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Remove cybertip link from report package page" (#8917) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Addresses: https://github.com/NuGet/Engineering/issues/4172

Removes an unnecessary link from the Report Package page (see issue for details).

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Feature]: How csproj to custom vaild signatures time?" (#8918) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Related Problem

https://github.com/andersnm/ExcelNumberFormat/issues/34

Hi @andersnm ,
For all clients, and I downloaded from NuGet official website and tested yesterday, you can use below CLI to test
```
dotnet nuget verify  "C:\Users\Wei\Downloads\excelnumberformat.1.1.0.nupkg"
```

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12729184/147842468-6584fa92-90a8-4227-a508-a8b7651354de.png)

Default clients will not use `nuget verify -signatures`, so system will ignore this error. But high level security company like government level they will use it, and it will upgrade to build error.


---

How csproj to custom vaild signatures time?
It looks like 2 years vaild time default, we would like to extend to 4 years.

### The Elevator Pitch

```
PS C:\Users\Wei> dotnet nuget
NuGet Command Line 6.0.0.280
```

### Additional Context and Details

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[NuGet.org Bug]: A11y_NuGet Service_Organizations_Email Notifications_HighContrast: In High contrast mode Keyboard focus is not completely visible on "Check boxes"." (#8924) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Impact

It's more difficult to complete my work

### Describe the bug

Source: https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1437973

### Repro Steps

1. Hit the URL: https://www.nuget.org/ 
1. Tab navigate to "Sign in" control and hit enter.
1. Tab navigate to "Sign in with Microsoft" control and hit enter.
1. Tab navigate to ‚ÄúManage Organizations‚Äù from the Profile Dropdown and hit enter.
1. Tab navigate to "Add New" control and hit enter.
1. Enter values in "Organization Name" and "Organization Email Address" and hit enter on "Add" Control.
1. Tab navigate to ‚ÄúManage Organizations‚Äù from the Profile Dropdown and hit enter.
1. "Organizations" screen gets opened.
1. Turn ON High Contrast mode and verify that all the elements of "Email Notifications" and check keyboard focus is completely visible or no "check boxes" in high contrast mode.

In High contrast mode keyboard focus is not completely visible on "check boxes" when we navigate using keyboard.

Note: This issue is also reproducing in select scope check box in API keys.

### Expected Behavior

The Keyboard focus should be completely visible on "Check boxes" when we navigate using keyboard.


### Screenshots

_No response_

### Additional Context and logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[NuGet.org Bug]: A11y_NuGet Service_Upload Package_Custom_Screenreader : Narrator is not announcing error message." (#8923) at NuGet/NuGetGallery

It's more difficult to complete my work

### Repro Steps

1. Hit the URL: https://www.nuget.org/ 
1. Tab navigate to "Sign in" control and hit enter.
1. Tab navigate to "Sign in with Microsoft" control and hit enter.
1. Select ‚ÄúUpload Package‚Äù from the Profile Dropdown and hit enter.
1. Tab navigate to "Custom" control and hit enter.
1. Check After press enter on preview button then getting error message and that error message narrator is announcing or not. 

After press enter on "Preview" button then getting error message and that error message narrator is not announcing. 

Only screenreader user will difficult to know the error message.

### Expected Behavior

Narrator should be announce error message.


### Screenshots

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[NuGet.org Bug]: A11y_NuGet Service_.Json_Version History_Screenreader : Narrator is not announcing column name as column header for "Version and Downloads"." (#8922) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Impact

It's more difficult to complete my work

### Describe the bug

Source: https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1438720

### Repro Steps

1. Hit the URL: https://www.nuget.org/ 
1.  Tab navigate to "Sign in" control and hit enter.
1.  Tab navigate to "Sign in with Microsoft" control and hit enter.
1.  Search for a key term (say ‚Äújson‚Äù) from search box.
1.  Click on "Newtonsoft.json" control and hit enter.
1.  Tab navigate to "Version History" control and hit enter.
1.  Turn on Narrator
1. Check Narrator is announcing column name as column header for "Version and Downloads".

Narrator is not announcing column name as column header for "Version and Downloads" column.

Note:
No issue observed in NVDA 
This issue is also reproducing in Statistics page also.



### Expected Behavior

Narrator should be announce column name as column header for "Version and Downloads" column.

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Additional Context and logs

_No response_

1. Hit the URL:https://www.nuget.org/
1. Tab navigate to "Sign in" control and hit enter.
1. Tab navigate to "Sign in with Microsoft" control and hit enter.
1. Search for a key term (say ‚Äújson‚Äù) from search box.
1. "Packages returned for json" screen gets opened.
1. Verify and check that the users can be able to distinguish between the normal text and link.

The users will not be able to distinguish between the normal text and link in  "Packages returned for json" 


### Expected Behavior

The links should be descriptive so that users will be able to distinguish between the normal text and link.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[NuGet.org Bug]: A11y_NuGet Service_.Json_InfoSection_Reflow : On Zooming the screen to 400% "Graph section" is not visible." (#8920) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Impact

It's more difficult to complete my work

### Describe the bug

Source: https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1439345

### Repro Steps

1. Hit the URL: https://www.nuget.org/
2. Tab navigate to "Sign in" control and hit enter.
3. Tab navigate to "Sign in with Microsoft" control and hit enter.
4. Tab navigate to search box and search for a key term (say ‚Äújson‚Äù).
5. Tab navigate and click on "Newtonsoft.json" control and hit enter.
6. Tab navigate to "Info" and "Statistics" section present on right of the screen.
7. Zoom the screen to 400% observe that "graph section" is not visible.

When we zoom the screen to 400% the "Graph section" present on the "Statistics" page is not visible. 

### Expected Behavior

The "Graph section" should be completely visible when we zoom the screen to 400%.


### Screenshots

_No response_

### Additional Context and logs

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[A11y][Reflow]Some of the information is missed when reflow is applied" (#8191) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Copied from https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1188115
## Browser Details:
Firefox Version: 79.0 (64 bit)

## OS Details

Microsoft Windows 10 Enterprise  ‚Äã

Version 2004 (OS Build 19041.450) 


## Note: 
Under 'Members' Administrator dropdown is not visible clearly after applying reflow
## Repro Steps:

    Change the Display resolution to 1280*1024 in System display settings
    Hit the URL and login with appropriate credentials
    Tab till "Open Profile drop down" and press enter
    Tab till "Manage organizations" and Press enter
    Tab till "Edit " present in any record the table and press enter
    Tab till Certificates and expand it 
    Apply reflow and Check whether data is missing or not  

## Actual Results:

Some of the data is missing when reflow is applied under the Certificates
## Expected Results:
User should be able to view the data without missing and all the information should be visible clearly with one scrollbar after applying reflow
## User Impact:
Users will not be able to see the information if it gets overlapped in reflow

## Notes
This is referencing the information on the Manage Organization page after setting minimum required CSS width (320 pixel). 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11051729/92166001-bdc39e00-edec-11ea-8679-fef816b3a1a3.png)
The information on this page entirely is difficult to see at the minimum width.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Document package bootstrapping scenarios" (#8917) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Not everyone uses NuGet for libraries only. 
The nupkg format is a simple zip with some metadata and it's used for many scenarios. 

We have many features that involve just download packages. 
NuGet.exe install package, direct download, PackageDownload etc. 

All these could yield a nice doc/write-up on all the ways you can do things with NuGet.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Bug]: PackageSourceMapping inconsistencies should be reported" (#11385) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product(s) Affected

NuGet.exe, MSBuild.exe, dotnet.exe

### Current Behavior

When there is a no source matching the source name of a `<packageSourceMapping>` (typically a typo, or maybe after a git merge), a restore can fail with a very generic error
```
error NU1100: Unable to resolve '<package>' for '<framework>'
```


### Desired Behavior

There should be a more helpful message.

Maybe a warning at the beginning if there is no source corresponding to a `<packageSourceMapping>` entry.


### Additional Context

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Bug]: IVsPackageInstaller sometimes deadlocks when called on background thread" (#11476) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

NuGet SDK

### Product Version

all?

### Worked before?

_No response_

### Impact

It bothers me. A fix would be nice

### Repro Steps & Context

Visual Studio extensions can reference `NuGet.VisualStudio` to use NuGet's APIs in Visual Studio, including `IVsPackageInstaller(2)` which can install packages in projects programatically.  In NuGet 6.0.0 (VS 17.0), [we documented that these APIs can be called from a background thread](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/pull/4209). However, under the following scenario there can be a deadlock:

1. The extension uses JTF.Run to run some async code that switches to a background thread and blocks the UI thread until this background thread work completes
2. The background thread work calls into `IVsPackageInstaller.InstallPackage`
3. NuGet's `VsPackageInstaller` uses `PumpingJTF`, but on the background thread, not the UI thread
4. When the project uses packages.config and the package contains `tools/install.ps1`, NuGet runs the powershell script, also on a background thread
5. Since NuGet passes `DTE.Project` to the script, the .NET runtime wants to do COM RPC on the UI thread, but the .NET runtime doesn't know anything about JTF and therefore deadlocks the code blocking in step 1.

The deadlock doesn't happen when none of the packages being installed contain a powershell files, or if the project uses `PackageReference` (since any powershell scripts aren't run).

**mitigation**: If the VS extension calling NuGet either does not block the UI thread (don't do step 1 above), or calls NuGet on the UI thread, then this will not deadlock.


### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Establish baseline for vulnerable packages installed" (#11112) at NuGet/Home
Opened issue "[Bug]: Reduce string allocations in restore code path" (#11475) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

dotnet.exe, MSBuild.exe, NuGet.exe

### Product Version

dotnet restore, msbuild restore on OrchardCore repo

### Worked before?

_No response_

### Impact

It bothers me. A fix would be nice

### Repro Steps & Context

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/52756182/147971321-a29c1350-2391-4b39-bf1e-462b21a9b7d7.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/52756182/147971327-72904df7-cad2-45af-8220-c11aba2d16cf.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/52756182/147971363-199ffd34-9754-4806-8c40-60c76d91179a.png)

I made few code changes in https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/tree/dev-kartheekp-ms-string-allocations branch which shows `20MB reduction in memory allocations` for `OrchardCore` solution restore scenario.



### Verbose Logs

_No response_
